fields.description:
I'm using the {table-plus} macro, but when the tag is wrapped around a table, the rich-text editor displays wiki markup.  E.g., if I create a table in wiki markup:

{table-plus}
||Header||Header||Header||
|blah|blah|blah|
|blah|blah|blah|
{table-plus}

then switching to rich text you see the wiki markup. I also put this on the developer JIRA, as I'm not sure at what point this happens (other macros don't appear to break the rt editor).
fields.summary: table-plus macro appears to break confluence rich-text editor

fields.description:

{noformat}
h1. {color:red}foo
{noformat}
bar
{noformat}
{color}
{noformat}

Color macro unstable near links in rich text editor

fields.description:
When entering users by copy/paste from a document, our dearest doze has a habit of adding a space to the end of a double-click selection ... this results in usernames such as 'myuser ' ... which is causing us issues.

Could the usernames be trimmed of all whitespace before being added?
fields.summary: Create user does not trim() usernames

fields.description:
* navigate to a space's News section
* click the feed icon in the top-right corner to view the content, or copy/paste the URL into your aggregator
* the title element is getSpace().getName()

Dashboard and Feed Creator feeds are fine.
fields.summary: Blog feed title is always getSpace().getName()

fields.description:
This will not render an image:

!image[1].jpg!

but a red text instead.  The solution is to escape the [ and ] in the filename with \'s.

Shouldn't the ! image tags escape the [ ] 's automatically?  It makes no sense to want to use []'s to create a link within a filename.
fields.summary: Square [] brackets in image filename should be automatically escaped by !this syntax!

For security, users would like a log indicating when users attempt to sign-in to Confluence. This would be useful for determining the source of a intrusion attempt such as the use of a dictionary-based login script.

This could be integrated with the existing user access logging. For example, create filters for login and logout IP and username as below.

2006-10-24 18:38:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - login FAIL 192.168.12.34 addmin
2006-10-24 18:58:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - login FAIL 192.168.12.34 adminn
2006-10-24 19:38:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - login OK 192.168.12.34 admin
2006-10-24 19:58:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - logout 192.168.12.34 admin
2006-10-24 18:48:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - login OK 192.168.12.35 smith
2006-10-24 19:48:58,560 INFO [atlassian.confluence.util.UserLoginLogFilter] doFilter - logout 192.168.12.35 smith
fields.summary: Logging of user login attempts

fields.description:
Right now, with static resources, we either have to serve with an Expires: header (which means that if the resource is changed by a plugin modification or an upgrade, browsers won't know), or we have to use Last-Modified/eTag (which means that the browser has to do a request/response round trip for every resource in a page, even if it doesn't need to be served.

By giving each resource a dynamic URL that changes when the resource changes, and then setting them to expire in the distant future, we can get the best of both worlds.

Candidates for this technique:

* CSS stylesheets
* Javascript files (this could mean we could do away with the combined Javascript servlet!)
* Plugin downloadable resources
fields.summary: Improve caching of static resources

fields.description:
Based on reply on Confluence support case  CSP-5640, we need to know the potential attempts in the confluence in access log for continuous monitoring.

The access log should allow logging of different things including success or non-success login with username or userid, date and time.
Any unsuccessful login may also require IP address for traceability.

Current Access log include so many debug information which did not serve the purpose of access logging for authentication or security purpose.
fields.summary: Provide more attempt related capturing in access log

fields.description:
When an image displayed by the gallery macro is clicked and enlarged, it should appear in a browser window with forward/back controls and a "Close" button.  All these conrols do function as expected when I'm using Firefox.

With IE (6.0), however, the forward/back controls do not appear.  Neither does the "Close" button.  Using the browser's "back" button takes you back 2-steps in the browser's history rather than just one.  Closing the browser window closes out the site itself.

This behavior can be viewed directly on the public site: http://www.constitutioncenter.org/penncord/display/showcase/Home
fields.summary: gallery plug-in loses "close" control with IE; browser's "back" action sends user back 2-steps in history

fields.description:
The CAPTCHA provider stores data in a temporary file in java.io.tmpdir. When you run multiple copies of Confluence with CAPTCHA enabled on the same server, they all use the same temp file. Hilarity ensues.

Also, there are security issues with creating predictable files in /tmp.

We should fix the CAPTCHA provider to store its temp files in confluence.home/temp
fields.summary: CAPTCHA uses a predictable temp file

fields.description:
The user interface for configuring general configuration of Confluence is inconsistent.
There are five subsections and each has it's own "EDIT" button. However, clicking on the EDIT button for a particular section to edit, enables editing of all sections. There are no associated "SAVE" and "CANCEL" buttons for each section, only one set of buttons to save or cancel overall configuration.

Administration >General Configuration
 
Site Configuration EDIT
Feature Settings EDIT
Security and Privacy EDIT
Formatting and International Settings EDIT
Attachment Settings EDIT
SAVE     CANCEL

I think it could be improved, so when you editing a particular section, say "Attachment Settings", only this section should be displayed to edit, not all. Similarly, enable cancel button for each section. 

Then there could be a mode "Edit All" and "Save All" to enable editing of all fields, which is the present behaviour. 

I think consistency should be enforced in this UI. Presently it appears to do one thing, edit subsection individually, yet it really enables editing of all sections. Hence, what is the point of all the "Edit" buttons ? :-) May as well have just three buttons. "Edit", "Save" and "Cancel" to edit the whole configuration at once, as presently designed.
fields.summary: Inconsistent UI for Confluence General Configuration

fields.description:
With version 2.2 (and before) of Confluence, when I changed the size of the "Recently Updated" section on the dashboard and returned to the dashboard, it would remember what size I had set the list to.  After moving to 2.2.9, I can change the size of the list OK, but when I return to the dashboard it goes back to the smallest list size (10, I believe).  It's like it is no longer saving the preference of what size I want the Recently Updated list to be.

The version 2.2.9 is a brand new installation, we didn't do an upgrade from 2.2 to 2.2.9.  We're exporting some spaces out of the 2.2 version and importing them in the 2.2.9 version.
fields.summary: "Recently Updated" list size on dashboard resets to 10 on each visit to dashboard

fields.description: I know that Confluence automatically updates the links of normal Confluence pages if the page is moved to another location.  However, I wanted to see if there was a way to update a template link.  For example, I usually provide my template link as a link "outside Confluence" by using the following URL "http://wiki/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?spaceKey=appdev&templateId=20&fromPageId=1521".  This creates a new page with a specified template ID 20 and creates as a child page from the page ID 1521.  However, the problem with linking this way is that if the template were to be moved, the URL link would not automatically be updated like the other Confluence pages normally would.  Is there another way to do this through Confluence links and not as a link "outside Confluence"?  Thanks.
fields.summary: Updating of template links

fields.description:
When you use {column:width=50}, the macro automatically adds the percent symbol to the end of the number, so that the value is specified as a percentage.

However, when you use {column:width=50px}, the macro still adds the percent symbol to the end of the width in the generated <td> element.  So, the width looks like this: width="50px%".  This is interpreted differently on IE and Firefox.  IE ignores the percentage sign, and interprets this as 50 pixels.  Firefox ignores the "px", and interprets this as 50%.

Please allow the "px" designation for column width, and do not append the percentage sign when "px" appears at the end of the width.
fields.summary: In the column macro, do not add the % symbol to the width when the user has specified "px" for pixels

fields.summary: Labels does not work in Turkish locale

fields.description:
We Recently pusrchased a Confluence Enterprise license, Test Installation went smoothly but When we started to use Confluence, We have seen an error box in Dashboard page (on the place of Spaces list), reading this:

Error rendering macro: org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateQueryException: undefined alias: DISTINCT [SELECT DISTINCT l FROM com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Label AS l WHERE l.namespace = :namespace order by l.name]; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.QueryException: undefined alias: DISTINCT [SELECT DISTINCT l FROM com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Label AS l WHERE l.namespace = :namespace order by l.name]

When we changed the Locale from Turkish to US it worked correctly. But this workaround is only a tempopary solution, because if we change the locale to English, PDF and doc exports do not show Turkish characteres correctly.

The bug is probably caused by infamous Turkish locale bug. Turkish lovercase i does not  became "I" but a dotted version of it, and Turkish "I" does not become "i" as well. Here is a recent article about this problem: http://java.sys-con.com/read/46241.htm 

Please try running confluence in Turkish locale.

This is a critical problem for us, looking forward to find a solution soon.
fields.summary: Confluence shows an Error Box on Dashboard when run in Turkish locale

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7166].
  {panel}

Hi,

do there exists any plans or plugins (by yourself or third party of which you know; commercial or free) for a more complex search? We already evaluated http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Advanced+Search+Plugin but this isn't what we're looking for.

We need several improvements of the current search:
- searching a subtree within a space (a single page and recursivly all it's childrens)
- searching for a specific time period. (not just last X days, but something like "from 10-10-2006 to 10-12-2006"

Any hint appreciated.
Regards
Markus
fields.summary: More complex search

fields.description:
Confluence.atlassian.com had memory problems where the heap allocation needed to be increased from normal 512 MB up to 1024 MB to not die with OutOfMemoryErrors. According to Donna:

"Charles was able to locate the problem.  There was a page that was using the children macro.  Unfortunately there were 2000+ children.  This was getting sucked into every recently-updated RSS feed.  Not pretty."

We should profile the children macro and reduce its memory usage, at least on subsequent calls which return the same result.
fields.summary: Children macro uses large amounts of memory with a large space

fields.description:
Deleting a user with an apostraphy (') in their name causes a SQL error.  This actually exposes a potential SQL injection exploit since the username is passed directly to the SQL statement and is not parsed for apostraphies.

Example:
1. Create a user with an apostraphy in their name.
2. Try to delete the user.
fields.summary: SQL problem with deleting users

fields.description:
{noformat}
DESCRIPTION
External Linking: URL names containing square brackets does not link

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
1. Edit in Rich Text
2. Click the "Insert/edit link" button -- the Link Properties window will appear
3. In the "Link" text box type: http://www.mysite.com/Document[foo].doc
    In the "Alias" text box type: My Document
    Click OK
4. OBSERVE: The Rich Text page looks fine.  -- There is a link named "My Document" underlined.
5.Click the Save button and you will be returned to the View page
6. OBSERVE: The link has now been changed to: 
    [My Document|http://www.mysite.com/Documentfoo.doc]

COMMENTS
In my company the square bracket is part of our document naming convention and is not easily changed (1200+ documents).
We were hoping to roll Confluence out by Christmas however this issue has brought it us to a standstill.  
It has been mentioned that we can use ([), however this is not practical as it is not intuitive and requires 
documentation for any user linking to any of our documents.

SUGGESTED RESOLUTION
Change the default linking character -- i.e. [[double]] brackets instead of [single] brackets
{noformat}
fields.summary: External URL names that  contain square brackets break the linking

fields.description: When linking to other pages, the "attachment" tab only allows linking to attachments on the current page.  Linking to attachments on other pages requires Wiki Markup and knowing the exact page & attachment names.  It would be nice to be able to browse or search for attachments just as you can for pages with the "Insert Link" edit button.
fields.summary: Easier ability to link to attachments on other pages

fields.description: There appear to be feature requests for font sizing macros, but it would be really nice to be able to change font sizes through a button on the rich text editor.
fields.summary: Ability to change font size from Rich Text editing
Change way how actions derive their I18n-translation-keys (don't not use classname anymore)

fields.description:
Currently, if there is a link to a page in another space a user doesn't have access too, the link shows up in red highlighed text.   My suggestion is to have the red highlighted text link to a customizable "You don't have access to this page" page.   This would serve several purposes:

* letting the user know what the red highlighting means - that the page exists, but they just don't have access
* the page could provide a way for the user to request access to that page/space through either an email link to the conf. admin or by a web form

This functionality could be further enhanced by allowing pages that the user doesn't have access to, to show up in searches (but only show page title, not content). This would let the user know that the content exists in a space somewhere, they just don't have access to it. And again, by providing the customized error page, the user can request access and if appropriate, the admin can grant access.
fields.summary: Links to pages don't have access to - provide link to "more information" page - on how to get access
Allow mail items to be marked as favourites

fields.summary: Embed / Render Word and Excel documents in Confluence pages

fields.description:
Searching for a phrase in quotes does not perform the expected match on an exact phrase, instead returns an AND search. Eg, searching for "The One" returns all pages containing "One" and "The".

Quotes should escape all search syntax and return only an exact character match.
fields.summary: Searching in quotes performs 'AND' search instead of 'exact phrase' search

fields.description:
Round tripping between the wysiwyg and markup editor corrupts link aliases that contain an image and text.

To reproduce use the following markup:

{noformat}
[!firefox.png|width=100, height=43! Firefox homepage|http://firefox.com]
or 
[!image.png|align=center!|Link Text]
{noformat}

*Original Report*
I have a region of content in the homepage of my personal space which gets "lost" when the page saves or if I toggle between WYSIWYG and Wiki Markup.  The source is as follows:

[!btn_profile_bluetxt_80x15.gif!|http://www.linkedin.com/in/gcorb] \| [JHED Profile|http://jhed.johnshopkins.edu/people/gcorb1] \| [!carepages_logo.gif|width=100, height=43! Michael's CarePage|http://michael.thecorbs.com] \| !delicious.med.gif! I am [geofcorb|http://del.icio.us/geofcorb] on [del.icio.us|http://del.icio.us] 

... which is rendered properly in the attached screenshot.

If I now go back and edit the page again, the source turns into:

[!btn_profile_bluetxt_80x15.gif!|http://www.linkedin.com/in/gcorb] \| [JHED Profile|http://jhed.johnshopkins.edu/people/gcorb1] \| [] \| !delicious.med.gif! I am [geofcorb|http://del.icio.us/geofcorb] on [del.icio.us|http://del.icio.us]

... and my reference to the graphic and link disappear.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor corrupts markup when image in the alias of links

fields.description:
When a user is removed from an external user repository (e.g. LDAP) their user name remains hyperlinked wherever the user name is rendered by Confluence. Clicking on this link results in a page not found as the user no longer exists.

We should disable hyperlinking in this situation.
fields.summary: User names are still hyperlinked for users removed from external repositories

fields.description:
The Search & Indexing engine is failing because it is opening too many files on the files system. See the full stack trace below. This is not an issue with Confluence directly the issue is documented on the following pages:
* http://wiki.apache.org/jakarta-lucene/LuceneFAQ
* http://www.onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2003/03/05/lucene.html

Suggested actions:
* It would be better if Confluence detected this exception and reported it gracefully - at present the exception is thrown all the way to the web container (ie we see Tomcat's 500 page).

Cheers.

Error page follows:
----
HTTP Status 500 -

type Exception report

message

description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request.

fields.description: When an AbstractLDAPPager repeats a query to get more results, it doesn't use the scope of the original query, so it may find nothing. This causes the symptom of only being able to see 100 LDAP entities in a pager.
fields.summary: groupSearchAllDepths and userSearchAllDepths not respected

fields.description:
Under Space Admin > Edit Space Label on the RHS - Add Team Label: Available Team Labels: $label.name, confluence selecting $label.name obviously generates: The following error(s) occurred: * Label name is invalid: team:$label.name AbstractSpaceLabelAction.getSuggestedLabelsForSpace() - editspacelabels.vm line 49 for loop Also, under 'Labels' the sub-heading Suggested Labels:: has 2 colons. The first one is from ConfluenceActionSupport.properties: available.team.labels=Available Team Labels: And the second one is added in editspacelabels.vm: $action.getText('addlabel.suggested.labels'):
The 'Suggested Labels' appear to only have 'favourite' in the list? Please confirm if this is expected behaviour. getSuggestedLabelsForSpace One more suggestion: Should we generate an notification when an user is adding a label that already exists? Ib
fields.summary: Add Team Label for a space displays $label.name if no team label is available

fields.description:
If you are on the 'edit permissions' screen and you hit the 'add' button without selecting anything to add, it should result in a validation error.

Currently it just behaves as if you'd hit cancel.
fields.summary: Clicking 'add' on the permissions administration screen when there is nothing to add should result in a validation error

fields.description:
Under Space Admin > Permissions > Individual Users

Users to add: ..... text box ..... [search][Add]

The Add button should be disabled till an user details are filled in.
Presently, when you press the 'Add' button, it does some processing and takes you back to the main 'Space Admin' page. Yet nothing changed as expected.

Should the button only be enabled only if user details were filled in?
fields.summary: The Add User button should be disabled till an user details are filled in.

fields.description:
I wanted to export the Administrator's Guide and the Confluence Developer's Hub documentation and this notice popped up.  Interestingly, Ben was able to open the PDF file on his Mac.

Steps:
Navigated to:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home
Then: Browse Space | Admin | Export Space
Then: 1. Export Format = PDF, 2. Other Options = both UNchecked, 3. Clear All except for Confluence Development Hub and Confluence Documentation Home | Administrators Guide
Then:  Export

Result:
When trying to open on a PC/WindowsXp machine, I get the attached error message.
fields.summary: PDF Export in Confluence broken when exporting multiple sections

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm trying to export spaces to HTML in a Quartz job. However, this fails when the exporter is gathering resources (images etc.) for the export. This is because resources are being retrieved using an instance of ServletContext but this is not available since the code is not run under a servlet. Here's the stack trace:

2006-10-09 14:54:01,523 ERROR [elma.confluence.export.ExportAllSpacesJob] doExecute Exception while exporting: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.ServletContextThreadLocal.getContext(ServletContextThreadLocal.java:19)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.copyExportedResource(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:212)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.copyResources(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:184)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.copyResources(HtmlExporter.java:222)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExportEntity(HtmlExporter.java:211)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.exportPage(HtmlExporter.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.exportSpace(HtmlExporter.java:114)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.doExport(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExport(HtmlExporter.java:40)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.exportAs(DefaultImportExportManager.java:113)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.AopProxyUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopProxyUtils.java:61)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:116)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:56)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:138)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:152)
        at $Proxy35.exportAs(Unknown Source)
        at net.elma.confluence.export.ExportAllSpacesJob.doExecute(ExportAllSpacesJob.java:47)
        at bucket.event.jobs.AbstractJob.executeInternal(AbstractJob.java:91)
        at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:66)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)

Maybe there should be another way to access the resources which doesn't involve ServletContext?

Locally I solved the problem using a crude hack (attached as a patch against Confluence 2.2.9): I created a servlet which is loaded on startup. It saves its context to BootstrapManager as a property. This saved servlet context is then used if one is not available otherwise.
fields.summary: A way to access resources of the Confluence web application from code not run under a servlet?

fields.description:
Hi,

accidently I dicovered the bug that I removed the permission of a user fo a space and then tried if the space is still visible for him on the dash board. It was not, but the favorite under MySpace was still there and I could access the space though the favourite link.

Cheers


Thomas

fields.summary: Oops on EAC staff home info page
Extend Confluence search capabilities to index Microsoft Project (MS Project) files

fields.description:
A customer has expressed concern at managing attachments and hard disk size. They want the ability to be able to:

1) Identify attachments that take up the most space 

e.g. many versions of a large file

2) Be able to easily delete versions of identified large files 

e.g. from version 3 onwards for movie1.mpg.

3) Be able to configure archiving (archive to zip files stored on a specified network location) or pruning operations based on key variables/rules based on size, age, version number and space location.

e.g. only retain the 3 latest versions of all files over 6 months old in Space X; only retain the 3 latest versions of all files over 6 months old across the entire site; only retain up to 10 versions for all files greater than 1MB and up to 20 versions for all files under 1MB across the entire site.
fields.summary: Enhance attachment management and provide configurable archiving/pruning

fields.description: A customer has requested the ability to export a page to Microsoft Excel. The biggest win here would be to at least allow content within tables on any page to be exported to Excel.
fields.summary: Export page to Microsoft Excel

fields.description: A customer has requested the ability to export pages in PowerPoint format, or to a format that PowerPoint can consume and retain document formatting integrity.
fields.summary: Export to PowerPoint

fields.description:
A customer has expressed dissappointment in the dependency on external POP services in order to add email integration to Confluence. 

Although being able to connect to external POP mail accounts is a great option, they would like to see the option of  being able to use a POP mail service from within Confluence. 

If Confluence had built in POP capabilities, Confluence would provide a more complete solution, and remove the requirement of users to have access to, or be able to organise the creation of, new pop mail accounts for each space requiring email integration/support.
fields.summary: Provide native email (POP) support from within Confluence

fields.description: A customer has requested that an Microsoft Outlook plugin to be created to allow Confluence content to be accessed from within Outlook, including content, news, attachments, mail, calendaring etc.
fields.summary: Create native Microsoft Outlook integration plugin
Extend Confluence search capabilities to index Microsoft Visio files
Improve copy and paste from Microsoft Excel into Confluence WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
When there are many LDAP groups, only the first 100 are shown. Even if a group has already been used in confluence (may use confluence), it might not show up any longer.

Also, when manually entering
/admin/users/domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=mygroup
for a group that is no longer displayed, there are no group members shown for that group

As soon as I limit the number of LDAP groups (by using an appropriate LDAP search filter), the group is shown again.

The groups still seems to work, even when not shown - at least the users of that group still can login.

However, this causes problems with the Custom Space Usergroups Management Plugin. If there is a large number of LDAP groups, the groups used for the confluence users is not shown and this plugin is used, the members of the group are not able to login anymore.

The LDAP server seems to work fine - it also returns all the groups (i.e. there is no limit on the entries returned). I checked this with ldapsearch.
fields.summary: not all LDAP groups shown
When versioning attachments, alert users that the attachment they are adding is going to be versioned

fields.description:
A customer has requested the ability to be able to add attachments whilst one is in the edit mode for any page. 

This is opposed to having the ability to add attachments only from within a seperate page/mode.
fields.summary: Add attachments from 'edit mode'

fields.description:
A customer has requested that the attachment tab in the link pop-up be improved in order to be able to navigate to other attachments other than those stored specifically on the individual page.

The customer expressed frustration in not being able to easily link to attachments stored on other pages, like child and parent pages, other attachments in the space, and other attachments in their Confluence instance.

At a mimimum they wanted the ability to be able to instantly see child and parent page attachments, and be able to easily navigate to attachments stored in the space or on other pages (all from within the link pop-up).

The customer also wanted the ability to search for attachments from within the link pop-up, either from the search tab, or from the attachment tab (currently searching from the link pop-up search tab, is restricted to pages only).
fields.summary: Extend and improve attachment browsing and usability in rich-text link pop-up
Allow group based redirects to specific pages on login (unless user home page already set)
